result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Surena M Sabala

records.addlTxt: DA Autho to Def re Electronic Evidence

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim minor children J.R & L.R (person, property, residence or family).  Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

*AMENDED 04/13/22 Deft may have contact with minor children J.R and L.R under direction of  CPS recommendations. House arrest monitoring to be removed.
NG plea entered.

8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Surena M Sabala in court.  Attorney Philip Edward Marry in court for Surena M Sabala. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense has filed a Request for Substitution.
Defense moves to address bond conditions, requesting contact with children J.R and L.R 
State objects to any modification.
BTC: Bond motion granted, Deft may have contact with minor children J.R and L.R under direction of  CPS recommendations. House arrest monitoring to be removed. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
